reviews.text: This is a really nice hotel. It is on the water overlooking Port Hardy's fishing fleet. Every room has an excellent view. The people are helpful and friendly. The pub next door was excellent too. A great experience.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We loved this hotel. We stayed for three days after a trip on the Inside Passage ferry from Prince Rupert. The staff were outstanding and went out of there way to help us with things. The owner even drove us in his stretch limo to pick up our rental car and then took us the same way to the bus station a few days later. It's one of the nicest places we have stayed and we hope we can go again some day.
reviews.title: A wonderful, clean and comfortable hotel
Dependable and Clean
reviews.text: My family has stayed at the Quarterdeck several times and their friendly service and clean rooms are very consistent each visit. They always have a well made fresh fruit salad which makes their free continental breakfast a cut above most. The Marina is right outside the door, which we like. All and all the ten to twenty or so extra dollars more we have spent there (compared to other Port Hardy motels) is worth it. We have been disappointed by others.

reviews.title: Clean and comfertable
reviews.text: As there is not many choices in Port Hardy I was suprised see such a well managed place. It was incredably clean and comfortable! Not to metion the beautiful view that we had from our room. There is also a wounderful small pub just down stiars that has exallent food and even better sea food. We extreamly injoyed our stay.

reviews.title: Big fish in a little pond
reviews.text: Not much to choose from in Port Hardy, but if you require a new facility, spotless rooms and friendly service this is the place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Port Hardy is a relatively small town and this is a small town hotel, however, it frequently sells out due to the people coming in on the ferry so it can charge a price that might be a bit steeper than it would be otherwise. For two nights for two people (one room) we paid a total of $336.40 (CD), including tax. The rooms are on the large size. We stayed on the top floor and the view of the harbor was very striking. The rooms are quiet, except for the banging of the doors as they close (they have a closing mechanism that insures they close with a bang). Even this wasn't too bad. There is no air conditioning (as is common on Vancouver Island) so in the summer room cooling is dependent on opening the window.
reviews.title: Great view, good night's sleep

reviews.text: The hotel is on the plain side, as is the room. However, for us it was a good place to get a night's sleep. There was a breakfast buffet included in the room charge. It was pretty basic but saved us from having to go out and hunt for a breakfast.
reviews.title: Decent place

likes.liked: — The look of the hotel and the eagles
likes.disliked: — The lack of pricacy in the ground floor rooms

reviews.title: Best place to stay in Port Hardy
reviews.text: The Quarterdeck Inn has comfortable rooms, a nice lobby and it looks good on the outside. It has a pub-type restaurant that serves decent food - nothing special but as to the negative reviews: what do these people expect in a small town? 3 Michelin stars? I liked the fact that there were local people in there, not just tourists like us.

reviews.title: Nice bay view but don't go to the pub!
reviews.text: The only thing I did not like so much was the fact that our ground floor rooms had very little privacy. But hey, they have eagles flying over the hotel. So why would you want to spend much time in your room anyway?

reviews.title: Expensive moderate hotel with good bay location
reviews.text: The price is high for such a small town but rooms are grabbed quickly for the ferry travellers....be sure to book early. Our room was clean and quite large ...a cot was added at no extra charge. Staff was helpful and friendly..nice views over the harbour.
